info: Decision tree using permutation test p-values for component classification
report: The permutation decision tree uses spatially-specific TE-dependence testing via permutation \citep{tedana_decision_trees}. Unlike traditional kappa/rho metrics which measure global TE-dependence, the permutation test evaluates whether each component's echo-wise structure specifically matches local T2* sensitivity patterns, providing a more principled statistical test for BOLD signal identification.
_comment: This decision tree uses permutation-based p-values (p_t2 and p_s0) to test whether components show spatially-specific TE-dependence. Low p_t2 indicates the component's echo-wise pattern matches local T2* sensitivity (BOLD-like). Low p_s0 indicates S0-driven signal (non-BOLD). The combination of kappa_star_perm and p-values provides robust classification.

nodes._comment: All components are initially labeled as 'unclassified'.
Calculate median variance explained for later thresholding.

Reject components with no spatially-specific TE-dependence (both p_t2 > 0.05 AND p_s0 > 0.05). These components have echo-wise structure that doesn't match local T2* or S0 patterns, suggesting non-physiological noise.

Reject components that are strongly S0-driven: low kappa_star_perm (< 0.2) AND significant S0 spatial specificity (p_s0 < 0.05). These are likely non-BOLD physiological noise (e.g., respiration, cardiac pulsation).
Provisionally accept components that are strongly T2*-driven: high kappa_star_perm (> 0.8) AND significant T2* spatial specificity (p_t2 < 0.05). These are very likely BOLD signal.
Provisionally accept remaining unclassified components with moderate-to-high T2* dominance (kappa_star_perm > 0.5) AND significant T2* spatial specificity (p_t2 < 0.05).
Provisionally reject remaining unclassified components with S0 dominance (kappa_star_perm < 0.5) AND significant S0 spatial specificity (p_s0 < 0.05). These are likely non-BOLD.
Provisionally accept remaining unclassified components with both significant T2* AND S0 spatial specificity. These are mixed-signal components that may contain BOLD signal worth preserving.
Provisionally reject any remaining unclassified components where rho_star_perm > kappa_star_perm, indicating more S0-driven than T2*-driven variance.
Accept provisionally accepted components where kappa_star_perm is at least twice rho_star_perm. Strong T2* dominance confirms BOLD signal.
Accept low-variance provisionally rejected components (< 0.1% each, up to 1% total). These don't explain enough variance to be worth rejecting.
Accept all remaining provisionally accepted components.
Reject all remaining provisionally rejected and unclassified components.
